intro: Lantana balansae f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower lantana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its foliage is usually aromatic and may have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
